Directions
In a medium saucepan, heat oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add onion and cook, stirring frequently, until softened and golden brown, about 8 minutes. Stir in sugar. Reduce heat to medium-low and add bay leaves, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and star anise. Continue to cook, stirring frequently, until spices are fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add fennel seeds and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in rice and season with salt. Cover rice with 1-inch cold water (about 3 cups; 710ml). Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to lowest setting, cover, and cook until water is absorbed and rice is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Serve warm.
Special equipment
